column5: I had clogged ducts early on in my breastfeeding journey before my son had his tongue tie corrected. I used to take a hot shower, then let my boobs hang down while I pumped. Let gravity help you. You can do it on hands and knees if you can stand it, but I would usually just sit and lean all the way over.
I‚Äôm having enough trouble with one! You go, Mama!!
The. Worst.
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not what I said, that‚Äôs just how you heard it.‚Äù Umm, I‚Äôm sorry, what? If I heard it, you said it.
I‚Äôve technically graduated this sub, but at 2 weeks PP I ended up in the ER with a UTI and a Kidney stone. Still trying to pass it. So painful. I feel for you!

When I was trying to lose weight before my wedding I actually used the meal plan they had given me in recovery as a starting point. Then I knew I would be getting at least close to enough. I broke it down by week instead of day, so instead of 2 fruits a day, it was 14 fruits a week. That way I had a little more flexibly. Worked for me!

I broke it down by week instead of day, so instead of 2 fruits a day, it was 14 fruits a week. That way I had a little more flexibly. Worked for me!
My birth story was very similar! I feel your pain, girl!

I have a 10 day old newborn. As of today we have locked it down. No more visitors, including our parents. There is too much exposure out there and not enough info on how the virus can affect a newborn or someone who just gave birth. My husband has been running errands as necessary, but I make him wash his hands and change his clothes when he gets home. People have asked to come visit and I‚Äôve said no. They can meet him in a few weeks when this all dies down, but if everyone doesn‚Äôt do their part now it‚Äôs going to get way worse. Cancel whatever you need to cancel to feel safe and comfortable. Don‚Äôt be afraid to be a bitch.
I‚Äôm an elementary school teacher. This is daily. ‚ÄúYour belly got bigger!!‚Äù Yep, kid and it‚Äôs going to keep getting bigger til the kid comes out. 39+5.
As the therapist writes in her notebook ‚Äúuses humor as a coping mechanism...‚Äù

I depends when the baby comes. If I make it to my due date or after, I should be okay. But if he decides to come early, it will probably affect my ability to care for him right after birth. I‚Äôve done a lot of research and the CDC recommends isolating the infant from the ill mother to prevent infecting the baby.
I was diagnosed with the flu yesterday :( and started taking Tamiflu. My OB was the one who recommended I get tested for the flu. I‚Äôm so frustrated that this is happening.
Currently 38+6 and working until Friday (39+4). I‚Äôm an elementary school music teacher so there isn‚Äôt a lot of sitting. 5 more work days! We got this, Mama!
Same thing happened to us! We adopted what we thought was a pit mix...100% Am. Staff. Love our girl :)
38 weeks and so ready for an Italian combo and a 16oz NEIPA.

I don‚Äôt think she graduated college. I remember in the episode where she interviewed to be the music teacher at a school they couldn‚Äôt hire her because she didn‚Äôt have a teaching certification or college degree.
Try aloe water or coconut water. As long as I start the day with that I can keep the heartburn at bay!
37+6, absolutely the same. Skipped meals yesterday, already ready for a second breakfast today. That‚Äôs pregnancy I guess!
Sounds like SPD. Stand up for yourself. I was in brutal pelvic pain and everyone was telling me it was normal. It was not and I was miserable.
I had to take one for work the week I found out I was pregnant...worked out pretty well for me that way!

I was diagnosed with Velamentous Cord Insertion at my anatomy scan at 19 weeks. At that point they were concerned about everything under the sun. I was scheduled for monthly growth scans to monitor baby‚Äôs progress. At my 23 week growth scan they were able to get better pictures and changed the diagnosis to Marginal Cord Insertion. Baby‚Äôs growth was good and MCI is less severe than VCI so I didn‚Äôt have another growth scan until 32 weeks. At 32 he was still growing well, but the insertion was still iffy so they left the MCI diagnosis so they can be aware of it at delivery, and more for my safety when they deliver the placenta than baby‚Äôs. I think Drs only get concerned when MCI/VCI babies are under the 10th percentile so low end of normal sounds fine to me!
Due 3/2 and my husband is 6‚Äô 6‚Äù. As my Dr told me today ‚Äúhe‚Äôs not a small baby.‚Äù
You are not alone! I posted something similar last week!
Ugh, Marc is awful.
And WHAT is with not giving gift receipts?! So much stuff in what‚Äôs probably the wrong size for the season and NO GIFT RECEIPTS. I also got about 1,000 hooded towels, also with no gift receipts.

I‚Äôve been complaining about this pain to my doctor for over a month now, and no one had mentioned SPD to me, but reading symptoms it absolutely fits what I‚Äôve been feeling. Everyone tells me it‚Äôs normal. Started for me around 31 weeks. Ice helps, kinda. I think I‚Äôm just getting used to the feeling....23 days until my due date, so I‚Äôm just going to deal with it.
Yep, I felt the same way looking at my baby shower pictures!
I hate bananas. I rarely ever eat them.
I‚Äôm sorry, a WHAT?! Lol üòÇ
I was nauseous until around 17 weeks so it could still be morning sickness, but it could be heartburn/reflux too if your throat is burning. Or it could be a virus. Drink lots of water.
Thrift store, borrow from friends and Stitch Fix!
No zofran, but I‚Äôm on a prescription prenatal with extra iron. Not sure if it‚Äôs making it worse or not.
FTM at 35 weeks with a 90th percentile baby and my belly feels so heavy! The belly band kinda helps....
Try eating dates!
Haha my 90th percentile baby boy is just everywhere! High enough to give me heartburn and low enough to give me hip and pelvic pain. Almost there.....

We told my in laws after my FILs 75th birthday bash. We just hung out until everyone else left and said we had a special present we wanted him to open. The day was still about him, but we got to share our joy too!
I had one at 32+6 and the other at 33+6. I was hoping to do them a little earlier, but it was too close to Christmas.
Damn, I wish. With all these stretch marks I feel like a monster.
35 weeks and the stretch marks are what kills me. Hate the way they look!

As a pregnant woman in recovery from an eating disorder, I can attest to the fact that the pregnancy has been a huge trigger for me. There are so many times that I‚Äôve felt utterly disgusting in my growing body. I haven‚Äôt resorted to any ED behaviors, because I know it‚Äôs not good for my unborn son, but the thoughts are there. It doesn‚Äôt sound like she is in a good state mentally to be able to handle a potentially triggering situation. Just my two cents.
Kohl‚Äôs, Stitchfix, Consignment shops and borrow from friends/family!
That‚Äôs a great idea! Thanks!
I was saying the exact same thing to my husband yesterday. #firegase

Congrats! Something just doesn‚Äôt feel right to me about him only having a true birthday every 4 years. Obviously, we would celebrate on a different day every year, but I want him to have a special day that‚Äôs all about him every year.
I‚Äôm due 3/2/20 and dreading the possibility of a leap day baby. I don‚Äôt want my sons birthday to be 2/29.

See, this is why I feel guilty and stupid for feeling this way. I don‚Äôt have any of this. It‚Äôs a completely normal pregnancy...I‚Äôm just tired and sore. I know it could be so much worse, so what gives me the right to have a day like this?
Only 31+3 and getting the same thing! 8 more weeks guys!
French Toast. It‚Äôs a texture thing. I never ate it before ‚Äòcause soggy bread seems weird to me. But I‚Äôve enjoyed it a few times during pregnancy. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüçû

Both my mother and mother in law had fairly easy pregnancies and they can‚Äôt understand why I don‚Äôt love it. I‚Äôm 31 weeks now, so I‚Äôm passed the nausea, but the fatigue/heartburn/insomnia/sciatic nerve pain/nosebleeds/shortness of breath are still going strong and I am so ready for my little man to be here!
Mind in the Making by Ellen Galinsky
32+6 and 33+6. I wanted to do them sooner but it‚Äôs been tough around the holidays.
Coconut water has been a huge help for me. Drink it before eating anything.
Unfortunately, no. We get it at Petco.
We were using the hills science diet sensitive skin and stomach one before we switched. Now she is on Acana.

What is the protein in the food? Poultry allergies are very common. The sensitive skin food did nothing for our girl because it was still a chicken protein. We switched to dog food with only fish protein and our dogs skin improved very quickly. You can try uncommon proteins like rabbit, fish, or venison. 

We also supplement with coconut oil. She won‚Äôt eat it in her food, but I melt some coconut oil and natural peanut butter together, and freeze it in an ice cube mould (of course I bought a cute paw print one...). Coconut oil can be used topically too. It has antibacterial and antifungal properties. 

For seasonal/outdoor allergies you can give a small amount (1tsp or less) of LOCAL honey which can help expose them to local pollen and may help them react less. It‚Äôs also anti inflammatory and antibacterial. 

No medical degree or vet training, just a dog mama with a allergic Am. Staffie! Hope that helps!!
Absolutely right there with you. 30 weeks and people at work were asking if I was coming back after Christmas....umm, yes, I still have all of Jan and Feb before my maternity leave starts.

Oooh yeah, I had one of these! I had a woman at work INSIST that I was way too big for however many weeks I was at the time and told me I probably had ‚Äúthat sugar thing‚Äù ‚Äòcause I was so big. I couldn‚Äôt wait to tell her that I passed my glucose test with flying colors. Also-my husband is 6‚Äô6‚Äù so....stfu. Lol

I‚Äôm no help, but I can relate. 11 years in recovery and 29 weeks pregnant. My hunger cues are COMPLETELY different in pregnancy and so hard to read. Eating intuitively is not really happening. BUT I am eating when I‚Äôm ‚Äúsupposed‚Äù to so that‚Äôs a plus. I guess start with eating a meal portion at meal times and seeing where that takes you?

Same! I hate mine. And now I‚Äôm getting them in my hips and thighs too even though I haven‚Äôt gained a ton of weight. Hubs says all the right things but I can‚Äôt get out of my own head. I‚Äôm in awe and amazed that my body is growing a tiny human, but disappointed that I‚Äôll never look the same. Vain? Probably. Oh well.

29 weeks and beef and pork are still far from the top of the list of things I want to eat. My husband made steaks one day and I had to ask him to eat it in a different room. I just want fruit all the time.
Lol, this post is a mood. 28+5 and totally with you.
Yes, same! I could lay on my back with a couple pillows until recently, but now I get lightheaded and nauseous if I try!
I have a pregnancy pillow. It helped a ton up until a few nights ago. Idk if I can do 10-12 more weeks of this....
I can only get comfortable on my right side, but I weigh too much right now to stay there very long. It hurts my hip to stay in one spot all night.
We ordered a recliner for the nursery! As soon as it gets here I‚Äôll be sleeping in it for sure!
I‚Äôm going to have to try this. My cousin and I are 7 months apart and more like sisters than cousins. Our babies will be 8 months apart!
Right, because that develops good feeding/eating habits....hmm you‚Äôre upset, ok, have a snack...smh üôÑ

Similar thing happened to me. I declined a drink at a BBQ at my Dad‚Äôs (we had planned to tell him ONLY that day) and my aunt just jumped to the conclusion and badgered me over and over until I finally just told her, but asked her not to share because it was still super early and we hadn‚Äôt been to the dr yet. 

In a later conversation with my dad he said ‚Äúeveryone is really happy for you.‚Äù Umm really Dad, because NO ONE is supposed to know yet! So I‚Äôm assuming he, his girlfriend and my aunt blabbed to everyone despite us asking them not to. So frustrating!!!

I‚Äôm a MOH in a wedding in July and I‚Äôm due 3/2/20. I ordered my bridesmaids dress yesterday, and I ordered one size up from my pre-pregnancy size. I couldn‚Äôt try the dresses on ‚Äòcause my bump (almost 27 weeks) is too big, but  I wanted to make sure I had enough room up top ‚Äòcause I plan to breastfeed. I know I‚Äôm going to need it altered in some way. I‚Äôm just praying it works out!
I totally get that, but at this point I don‚Äôt look at it as a luxury anymore. It‚Äôs a necessity. It‚Äôs worth the money to feel good!

Have you tried prenatal massage? I swear my friend/massage therapist saved my life earlier in my pregnancy when it was bad. I go about every 3 weeks now and it has definitely kept the sciatic nerve pain at bay. I occasionally have flare ups, of course, but for the most part it is very manageable now. Avoid long car rides, particularly if you are driving, and try the tennis ball trick from an earlier post.

Lol! I‚Äôm in the same situation! I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4‚Äù and was 7lbs at birth. My hubs is 6‚Äô6‚Äù and was 9lbs 6oz at birth....babe has been measuring big all along! Not sure how we are going to get him out!

I agree with sikkerhet for two reasons. 

1) When I was in (outpatient) treatment I was exhausted, physically and emotionally ALL the time. I can home from my program and immediately went to sleep, almost daily. Not sure if this is the norm or not, but there is no way I would have been able to participate in or maintain any kind of romantic relationship. 

2) In a weird and twisted way, the eating disorder is kinda like a boyfriend. Obviously not a good one, he‚Äôs a abusive prick, but for me it was like having an sadistic partner in my head all the time. So, jumping into a relationship with someone who is ‚Äúbreaking up‚Äù with their relationship with food and their body may not make a ton of sense. You probably don‚Äôt want to be the person to replace the eating disorder in her life. She needs to develop a strong sense of who she is without the ED before diving into a new relationship. You don‚Äôt want to be the ED rebound, you know? I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôm making any sense here, but hopefully I am!
26 weeks, my husband put my socks and shoes on for me today. I totally get it.
I know someone who didn‚Äôt find out she was pregnant until about 4 months in, and was a pretty heavy social drinker up to that point. Her babies (triplets!) are totally fine!

‚ÄúHave you been checked for the sugar thing? (gestational diabetes) You are so big already. You shouldn‚Äôt be that big yet.‚Äù


Umm actually, that‚Äôs a 3rd trimester test and I‚Äôm in my second trimester, my Dr. described my weight gain as ‚Äúperfect‚Äù and my husband is 6‚Äô6‚Äù so we anticipated a big baby. Back the fuck off.
26 weeks with one big baby, and I‚Äôm right there with you! It‚Äôs 4:40am....

They told me my little man was in the 84th percentile and he weighed 1lb 7oz at 23 weeks. My husband is 6‚Äô6‚Äù and looks like he belongs in the NFL so we were expecting a big baby. Husband was 9lb 6oz at birth and 22‚Äù long and never wore newborn clothes. I‚Äôm anticipating my little guy will be similar. We will find out in around 14 weeks!
I think that‚Äôs a big part of what upset me! I‚Äôm usually really active and enjoy moving and I feel like I‚Äôm carrying around a bowling ball and feel so unhealthy.
That‚Äôs part of why I cried!

Yes, it‚Äôs a subscription service. It comes to your home as often as you‚Äôd like. You can put your style choices and fit preferences into the app so it knows what you are looking for. Before becoming pregnant I had it set for tighter fitting pants and looser fitting tops, and they have continued to send me those things during pregnancy. Now that I have it set to maternity, I‚Äôve gotten a few maternity pieces, a few open cardigan type sweaters that can be worn pregnant or not and some really cute jewelry. I love it!
Stitchfix!
I started really showing (not bloat) around 16 weeks.

I have gotten regular massage for years, and told my friend/massage therapist pretty soon after we found out we were pregnant. I was able to lie on my stomach for the first two or three appointments after finding out, but now (25 weeks) I lay on my side. As far as I understand it, it‚Äôs mostly about your comfort level. Baby is super padded in there in the first trimester. Definitely mention it, but I wouldn‚Äôt worry.
Stitchfix!

Same thing happened to me (F, 30) as a teen. I am so sorry you have to deal with this. BUT there are ED diagnosis that don‚Äôt require you to be underweight. It used to be called EDNOS (Eating disorder not otherwise specified) but now I think it‚Äôs called OSFED (otherwise specified feeding and eating disorder) I know internet research for medical stuff is not always the best idea, but maybe look into those? Not sure where you are located but the NEDA website may have some reputable resources. I was treated through Renfrew and they have multiple locations as well. Good luck!!
I don‚Äôt have any personal experience, but check out DissociaDID on YouTube/Instagram/Facebook!
We are registered for a class at the hospital in December.

Well, yeah, ultimately I‚Äôd like him to feel confident in his ability to care for our son too, but I‚Äôm trying to give him the benefit of the doubt right now because his father just died. If it‚Äôs any small comfort to him to know that I know what I‚Äôm doing, I‚Äôll take it. His comment made me feel good because all I‚Äôve heard my whole pregnancy is that all my experience doesn‚Äôt mean anything because it wasn‚Äôt my own child.

It‚Äôs so tough! My hubs said he isn‚Äôt sure if it‚Äôs going to feel real until the baby is here. It‚Äôs easy for me ‚Äòcause I feel him move all day and I‚Äôve wanted this for so long. I hope DH can connect with him when he arrives!
I couldn‚Äôt convince my husband to go with me, and he regretted not going afterward. Pay attention and enjoy!
Aloe water has been working for my heartburn!
BLTs were the only thing I could tolerate in my first trimester. I ate like 4 a week. My food loving husband complained about all the bacon. Don‚Äôt worry about it.

Ugh, yes, a coworker of mine comments every time I see her and I have to keep explaining that yes, my belly is going to get bigger every time you see me because I am further along in the pregnancy each time. My weight gain is right on track with what my Drs want. I am healthy, baby is healthy. STFU about how big I am.
The month we conceived I had dreams about baby‚Äôs two nights in a row, and I remember telling my husband about it and saying ‚ÄúI think this is our month!‚Äù And it was!

I had to have the same conversation with my husband. Don‚Äôt jump out and scare me. Don‚Äôt startle me because you think it‚Äôs funny. I can literally feel my heart go into overdrive and I cry every time. It‚Äôs not funny to me. He‚Äôs been respectful of that since we had the conversation.
I got a vvfl at 9dpo, much stronger at 11+. You could definitely still be pregnant. Test again in a few days.
